trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when the user decides not to trust the entity that is requesting a token after reviewing the information from their certificate.
This exception is thrown when the user clicks "I am not satisfied with this organization's identity/policies" in the [!INCLUDE[infocard](~/includes/infocard-md.md)] user interface.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UntrustedRecipientException"></xref> class.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UntrustedRecipientException"></xref> class with the specified error message.

This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error and takes into account the current system culture.
The content of the message should be understandable to the user.
The message that describes the error.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UntrustedRecipientException"></xref> class with serialized data.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that contains the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UntrustedRecipientException"></xref> class with the specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
